column1: Seeheim-Jugenheim is a municipality in the Darmstadt-Dieburg district in Hesse
column2: Germany.  It has a population of approximately 17

column1: Stettbach (population 144)The municipality was formed on January 1
column2: 1977 through the unification of the previously separate municipalities of Seeheim and Jugenheim.  Until January 1
column3: 1978 the municipality was known as Seeheim; after that it became known as Seeheim-Jugenheim.

column1: It is known for its mountain bike trails to the nearby mountain Melibokus.
Seeheim-Jugenheim has been home to several notable residents throughout history
column2: including Tsar Nicholas II of Russia as well as writers Georg Kaiser and Helene Christaller.

column1: Further it has been an ancient Jewish Community.
Industrial and commercial activity in Seeheim-Jugenheim is close to nonexistent; thus
column2: most of its residents work in the nearby cities of Darmstadt
